column4: Flowserve supplying pumps, valves for Pfizer vaccine production
column5: (Reuters) - Flowserve Corp, an American supplier of industrial machinery, said on Monday it was providing pumps, valves and seals to Pfizer Inc to support the production of its COVID-19 vaccine.
column6: The company said it helped the drugmaker replace a mechanical mixer seal on its vaccine production line at a plant in Kalamazoo, Michigan.
column7: The vaccine is one of the three authorized for emergency use in the United States along with Moderna and Johnson & Johnson.
column8: A Flowserveâ€™s facility in Tennessee will supply Pfizer with more than 200 ball valves that can handle the cold temperature requirements needed to support the mass production of the vaccine, the company said.
column9: The Irving, Texas-based company said it was also providing pumps to Pfizer for both their North American and European vaccine production.

column4: Emerson Electric names Mark Blinn to its board
column5: Nov 5 (Reuters) - Emerson Electric Co said on Tuesday it named Mark Blinn, former chief executive officer of industrial pumps and valves supplier Flowserve Corp, to its board of directors.
column6: The U.S. factory automation equipment maker is under pressure from hedge fund D.E. Shaw to break up the company.
column7: The New York-based hedge fund, which owns a more than 1% stake in the Ferguson, Missouri-based company, wants Emerson to split into two businesses - the industrial automation business and the climate technology-focused unit.
column8: The hedge fund has said the move could unlock more than $20 billion worth of shareholder value.

column4: BRIEF-Flowserve Corp Reports Q1 Earnings Per Share $0.12
